p: The cowpea weevil, Callosobruchus maculatus Fabricius (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Bruchinae), is a cosmopolitan pest of legume seeds and is among the most serious pests of stored products in tropical countries [ 20– 22]. The insect larvae represent the most destructive stage, as adult cowpea bruchid do not feed [ 23, 24]. However, as the availability of a specific host is highly discontinuous and because these adult insects have to live in hosts that are normally treated with insecticides [ 25– 27], these insects might have to face insecticidal sublethal exposures prior to deciding where they are going to lay eggs.
